fields.headline: In brief
fields.bodyText: Arnie widens rift with Bush California governor Arnie Schwarzenegger has urged state voters to back plans to sell bonds to fund stem cell research, deepening his split with the Bush White House over bioethics. Oliver Burkeman, New York. Bird flu kills 23 tigers in zoo Bird flu killed 23 tigers at a zoo in Tak, east of Bangkok, after they were fed raw chicken. Reuters, Tak. Boy shoots parents dead A boy, 13, shot dead his sleeping parents in Talmenka, Siberia, for thrashing him over his poor marks at school. Reuters, Moscow Nicaragua coup plot warning Nicaraguan president Enrique Bolanos yesterday accused opposition leaders of plotting a coup by instigating a congressional corruption inquiry that could remove him from office. Reuters, Managua Burmese PM arrested The Burmese prime minister Khin Nyunt is under arrest after a power struggle in the junta, dimming reform hopes. Reuters, Bangkok Father wins rape damages A father jailed but later acquitted in 1998 of raping his daughter won £50,000 from a Milan court yesterday after it emerged her evidence was partly crafted from the Demi Moore film Disclosure. Reuters, Milan
